title: Stacey Solomon reveals heartache as she stops breastfeeding five-month-old
text:
Stacey Solomon has admitted she 'felt like a failure' after she was forced to stop breastfeeding her five-month-old son, Rex.

The Loose Women panellist, 30, took to Instagram on Sunday to reveal she has been giving her baby boy formula for the past two months and initially felt uneasy telling people.

Alongside a picture of herself bottle feeding Rex, Stacey revealed she had been struggling to produce enough breast milk and after two days back at work, she quickly 'dried up'.

Honesty: Stacey Solomon, 30, took to Instagram on Sunday to reveal she has been giving her baby boy formula for the past two months and felt uneasy telling people

'Before I knew it my breastfeeding journey was over,' she wrote in a lengthy post.

Just five days after Rex was born he had to be taken back to hospital because he had lost weight due to issues with feeding, she said.

'Breastfeeding never happened for me the way that I imagined. I did my best to try & master it, but it wasn’t to be.

'On day 5 we ended up back in hospital because of weight loss & I ended up pumping in between feeds to make sure he put it back on so we could be discharged, then I continued this at home until he reached his birthweight.

Hospital trip: Just five days after Rex was born he had to be taken back to hospital because he had lost weight due to issues with feeding, she said

'I then tried to switch to exclusive breastfeeding but whenever I did he lost weight again & It would break my heart to think that my own want to breastfeed was not helping my baby grow so I mix fed.

'As he got bigger his demand for milk got higher & my boobs couldn’t keep up the supply. [sic]'.

She initially apologised for the length of her post before revealing she was finally comfortable telling people she stopped breastfeeding 'a couple of months ago'.

Open book: Stacey Solomon has candidly discussed her relationship with boyfriend Joe Swash following the birth of their baby son Rex

'Sorry for the essay... So Lots of people have been asking me if I’m still breast feeding.

'It’s taken me a bit of time to feel okay about saying no. I stopped a couple of months ago & I really struggled to come to terms with it & actually say it out loud,' she wrote.

Stacey then revealed that the decision to breastfeed was taken away from her completely, when she stopped producing milk, and she started to feel like she had 'failed' and lost the chance to bond with her baby.

Candid: Stacey welcomed baby Rex in May with partner, Joe Swash, and has been praised for her candid posts on motherhood and parenting

She revealed: 'By the time I did two full days back at work without him on the boob or pumping my milk dried up & before I knew it my breastfeeding journey was over.

'I felt sad for quite some time, every time he rooted my gut ached. I felt like I’d failed & that I’d lost the chance to have that special time & bond with Rex.

'I felt like everyone else was going to feed him & I’d loose my baby. I felt like I should have done more to master it in the first 24 hours & I should have done more research & asked for help.

Family: The former X Factor star also has children Zachary, 11, with her ex Dean Cox, and Leighton, seven, with her ex Aaron Barham)

'But as time has gone on, I’ve realised the truth. The truth is, I did my absolute best. Every baby is different.

'I’m so lucky I have a few wonderful breastfeeding memories & some women don’t get that chance.'

Explaining that she still had 'an extremely special bond with Rex,' despite others taking their turn to feed him, she revealed she loves bottle feeding.

'I have an extremely special bond with Rex, one that would be there wether I breastfed or not, he grew in my tummy and we’ve known each other for a long time (we go way back) I love bottle feeding, it’s nice to share the feeding with Joe & our family sometimes too, they’re not stealing him away, just helping & bonding too.

'Doing things differently wouldn’t mean my journey would have been any different.

'He was a small, tired little pickle & he struggled to feed. But the most important thing is he was fed bottle/breast it doesn’t matter. Mamas u really are incredible. [sic]'.

Grief: Stacey Solomon revealed that her boyfriend Joe Swash was hit hard by the trauma of his father's death after welcoming their son Rex in May (pictured together recently)

Stacey welcomed baby Rex in May with partner, Joe Swash, and has been praised for her candid posts on motherhood and parenting.

The former X Factor star has sons Zach, 11 and Leighton, seven, from previous relationships.

Meanwhile, Joe is also father to 12-year-old Harry, who he shares with ex Emma Sophocleous.
